Issues.Title: Column class 'is-full-tablet' not respected
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. It is a **bug**. ### Overview of the problem I'm using Bulma **version** 0.8.0 ### Description The `is-full-tablet` column class is not being respected when there is a top level size, such as `is-one-third` or `is-two-fifths`. ### Steps to Reproduce This is basic html that outlines the issue: ``` Hello Bulma!
Column 1
Column 2
``` ### Expected behavior Column 1 should fill the whole window once the window is < 1024px wide and Column 2 should disappear. ### Actual behavior Column 1 fills the whole window once the window is < 769px wide and Column 2 disappears when the window is < 1024px wide. ### Notes I am able to get my desired behaviour by setting Column 1's class to `"column is-full-mobile is-full-tablet is-one-third-desktop is-one-third-widescreen is-one-third-fullhd"`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Column class 'is-full-tablet' not respected" (#2837)

Issues.Title: Notification inside Hero may make Title & Subtitle unreadable
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.8.0] My **browser** is: Chrome Version 80.0.3987.106 (Official Build) (64-bit). I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description When embedding a Notification inside a Hero, the Title and Subtitle classes may not be readable. The Hero.Title and Hero.Subtitle colors override the Notification -- so when the Notification has a contrasting color to the Hero, the font colors are light/light or dark/dark instead of light/dark. ### Steps to Reproduce ```html

Title

Subtitle

Some content.

Title is legible

Subtitle is legible

Some content.

Title

Subtitle

Some content.

Title is not legible

Subtitle is not legible

Some content.

``` ### Expected behavior I would expect that the Title and Subtitle would be controlled by its surrounding Notification, not the parent Hero. ### Actual behavior Instead, the Title and Subtitle are impacted by the Hero.

Issues.Title: NavBurger disappears with Night Mode on Samsung Internet Browser
Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

I have a basic web site that uses the traditional [navbar-burger](https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#navbar-burger) with JavaScript toggle.

When using *Samsung Internet Browser* with *Night Mode* enabled (aka *Dark Mode*), the burger is practically hidden -- it is basically black on black, so the button works if you know it is there, but it isn't obvious that it is there.

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.8.0
My **browser** is: *Samsung Internet Browser* 
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

<!-- Description of the bug, enhancement, or question -->

### Steps to Reproduce

If you have a Samsung phone, just activate Night mode and then pull up bulma.io using _Samsung Internet Browser_ (not Chrome).

Alternatively, you can run a Samsung Simulator for free here:  https://developer.samsung.com/remote-test-lab

### Expected behavior

The text gets reversed in Night Mode, so that displays fine.  However, the burger spans aren't changing color, so they are black on black.

I need the burger to be visible in Night Mode AND Light Mode.

Issues.Title: Duplicate sizes causes missing .is-size-* and .title.is-* declarations
Issues.Body:
- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
- I'm using Bulma's **master branch**
- I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

Due to the way `@each` and `index()` are used in the size helpers, Bulma will only generate CSS for the first of any duplicate sizes definitions. A duplicate size definition would look like this:

```sass
$size-1: 100px
$size-2: 100px
@import "bulma"
```

This happens because `index()` always grabs the index of the _first_ matching value. Because this is a nuance specific to `index()`, this bug only affects 3 places in the Bulma codebase:

1. https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/0c43b9e4663ae040d47d2a373ded5ba914b7d10f/sass/base/helpers.sass#L25-L28
1. https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/0c43b9e4663ae040d47d2a373ded5ba914b7d10f/sass/elements/title.sass#L49-L52
1. https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/0c43b9e4663ae040d47d2a373ded5ba914b7d10f/sass/elements/title.sass#L67-L70
### Steps to Reproduce

I setup an example repository with the compiled CSS where you can see the current behavior:

- Code: https://github.com/hkgumbs/bulma-size-bug-demo
- Demo: https://hkgumbs.github.io/bulma-size-bug-demo/
- TL;DR
  1. Set variables `size-1` and `size-2` to the same value (i.e. `100px`)
  1. Compile Bulma via the normal means
  1. Compiled CSS **does not** include declarations for `is-size-2`/`is-2`

### Expected behavior

Bulma would produce declarations for `is-size-1`/`is-1` _and_ `is-size-2`/`is-2`. All of these declarations would be set to the same value (`100px` in this case).

### Actual behavior

Bulma produces 2 declarations for `is-size-1`/`is-1` and 0 for `is-size-2`/`is-2`: https://github.com/hkgumbs/bulma-size-bug-demo/blob/master/output.css#L378-L382
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Duplicate sizes causes missing .is-size-* and .title.is-* declarations" (#2802)

Issues.Title: Container within section is wider than section at some screen widths
Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem
This is about the Bulma **SASS framework**
I'm using Bulma  0.7.4 (but cannot see reference to this since that was released) -->
My **browser** is:  Chrome 79.0.3945.130
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

My pages are structured using a series of sections within the body element.  The first part of the body contains a section, which contains a container, which contains the navbar; this is followed by a 'hero' section, then a further section each containing a container.   

At some screen widths - for example 1500px wide - the widths are anomalous.  Body is 1485px wide, and the section is 1325px, but the container is 1344px.  

This leads to the site appearing misaligned at this screen size (and others).

Example at www.catholicfamilynottingham.uk.    Screenshot attached. 

![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/24808522/73677344-ee542580-46ad-11ea-9d43-b97447147716.PNG)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Container within section is wider than section at some screen widths" (#2798)
